details:
Location:
Plano – 8300 Preston Road Suite 150, 75024. T: 214-407-7007
Fairview, 341 Town Place 75069 T: 972-363-0069.
*New Location for 2023* Castle Hills, 3964 TX-121 suite 700, The Colony, 75056
Hours:
Friday and Saturday 9 AM–8 PM
Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday 9 AM-6 PM
Monday through Sunday: $14.99 for the first hour and $4.99 for any additional hours.
This is one of our favorite places for toddler activities nearby and really is a fun place for kids.
Cheeky Monkeys is an “edutainment” kids play area nearby, indoor playground & birthday celebration destination for children from 10 months to 8 years old.
It provides an unparalleled arena for daily social and educational interactions focused on children and teachers and children and parents.
✓ Over 3000 square feet of FUN!✓ Up to Multi-level play structure with slides, trampolines & climbers✓ Daily FREE Kids Activities✓ Single play structure & ball pit for toddlers✓ Oversized party rooms✓ With amazing party packages✓ Lifesize Monkey Clubhouse✓ Peanut & nut aware facility✓ Awesome kids after-school activities✓ Hot & cold beverages and treats while Parents enjoy FREE WiFi!
Cheeky Monkeys also caters kids’ parties.
Once you call to book the time, date, and a room big enough to contain the fun, they’ll make sure your party room is 100% ready— they’ll take care of the planning, games & entertainment, the set-up, the clean-up, the cake, and more so you don’t have to sweat it.
They also do themed indoor birthday parties with advanced notice, adding the little details that help give your little royal the party of their dreams.

name: Safari Run
details:
Location: 2300 Coit Road, Suite 300, Plano, TX 75075
It’s a fun and very health-conscious indoor playground and kids’ play area nearby.
It’s a really easy and manageable venue, for parents with very young kids and multiple numbers to supervise. Be sure to leave any food or drinks at home, but they sell healthy snacks of all varieties to eat there.
Weekends are always closed to private parties, so for open play check with them for times you can drop in.
Kids must wash their hands before and after playing. Healthier snack options are for sale and they also have a fun game room – perfect for a kid’s play place and one of our favorite indoor playgrounds.
Memberships are available. Check with the venue for updated pricing

name: Kid Mania
details:
Location: 7252 Chase Oaks Boulevard, Plano 75025
Hours:
Monday – Thursday 10 am – 9 pm
Friday 10am – 10pm
Saturday 9am – 10pm
Sunday 11am – 8pm
A safe and fun play place for kids of all ages to climb and explore with an area for Toddlers to play within this Indoor Playground. This is perfect for a rainy day or when it’s too hot with tons of toddler activities nearby and a really big indoor play structure
Prices depend on age.
Kid Mania also has a great snack bar and a fun game room with an arcade upstairs.
Bring socks for the kids or buy them at $1 a pair.

name: The Shops at Willow Bend
details:
The small but perfectly formed indoor kids play space can get crowded but this is a great free option nearby! (Perfect for toddlers that need to get some wiggles out.)
The Plano Indoor Playground is located on the lower level near Crate & Barrel.
With a nod to Plano and its historic Haggard Park, the mall’s new 1,960-square-foot Plano Playground will welcome little ones with a gazebo.
Once inside, they’ll enjoy climbing on the soft, one-of-a-kind play pieces including a water fountain, slide, sandbox, teeter totter, fire truck, ambulance and merry-go-round, all constructed of hand-sculpted, kid-friendly foam.
Kids can rock and ride the mascots of local high schools — Plano East, Plano West, and Plano Senior High. A hot air balloon lights the play action from above.
Along with an interactive game wall that looks like the hospital, a scavenger hunt in the play area will feature hidden hospital icons for children to find, evoking the popular Highlights magazine often found in doctors’ offices.
The multi-sensory play area includes sound-chip technology, adding surprise and delight to complete the experience. The play area is suitable for children 42 inches or shorter.

name: Library Story Time
details:
Another free option and perfect for younger kids at any of the Plano Libraries!
If you have older kids then make sure they are checking out books for their summer reading list and participating in the Barnes and Noble summer reading program to earn free books!

name: Playstreet Museum
details:
Location: 964 W Parker Rd #120, Plano, TX 75093
This is such a cute place for younger kids to create and play.
The cost is $13 for children 1-8. Children younger or older are free.
Themed as the great outdoors, this indoor playground center is currently offering playtime by reservation as well as birthday parties and events.

name: Prestonwood Baptist Church Playspace
details:
Location: 6801 W. Park Blvd. Plano, TX. 75093
(10 and under only) FREE!!!
Open Monday – Friday 10 am – 4 pm
Restrooms & water fountains are available at this clean and easily accessible indoor playground and kids play area. It’s a really fun place for kids nearby.

name: Monster Yogurt
details:
Location: 1360 W Campbell Rd, Ste 101, Richardson, TX 75080 (Next to Tom Thumb)
A frozen yogurt place with a kids play area?? Yes!
The indoor playground area is small but it will give the kids something to do when they are done eating.
This isn’t exactly Plano, but really close in Richardson off Coit/Campbell area! There is also a Dallas location.

name: Crayola Experience Plano
details:
This huge indoor playground space, at The Shops at Willow Bend, is a great option if you’re looking for a bigger kids play area or kid play place with tons of toddler activities nearby.
We have a discounted daily rate of $5.50 off or you could invest in membership too at a discount rate:
Buy here
We have tons of Top Tips to enjoy it as a family

name: Kidzania
details:
Location: Stonebriar Mall, 2601 Preston Road, Suite 3011, Frisco, Texas 75034
Every activity at KidZania is the perfect combination of fun and learning – one of our favorite fun places for kids.
For example, children learn about human anatomy while performing surgery on a mannequin at the Hospital, get a degree in archaeology at the University, or create a nutrition & workout plan at the Fitness Studio.
Each activity is created by professional educators to blend in the local school curriculum for deeper, more advanced outside-the-classroom learning.
Hours: vary per day. Currently open Friday 2 pm – 8 pm, Saturday & Sunday 12 pm – 7 pm
Super fun for Kids for a half-day or all day trip (but best suited for kids over the age of 4)
Pricing:
Children 3 and under FREE
Children 4-5 $14.95
Children 6-14 – $42.95
Adults 15+ years – $14.95

name: Dino Kidz
details:
Location: 1201 W. McDermott Drive, #112, Allen, Texas 75013
Hours: vary. They offer Storytime every Tuesday and Thursday
Pricing: $11.99 per child $10.99 for siblings, one adult free with each child
Dino Kidz is a children’s indoor playground designed for the excitement of our young visitors.
Kids can celebrate with the ultimate birthday party, or develop their fine and gross motor skills through play, unique classes, and using their imagination in a safe, clean environment. (10 months – 7 years).
Must wear socks.
Up to 10 year olds are allowed for a private birthday party.

name: Frisco Fire Safety Town
details:
Location: 8601 Gary Burns Dr, Frisco, TX 75034
Monday to Friday 8 am – 5 pm, Tours are available by appointment only

name: Sci-Tech Discovery Center
details:
Location: 8004 Dallas Pkwy, Frisco, TX 75034
Hours: Opens at 10 am (open Tuesday – Sunday)
Currently offering timed tickets, $10 for ages 3 and up
Many of these offer Kids Play places nearby offer free entrance with the purchase of a Pogo Pass.
Urban Air – indoor trampoline parks with locations in Frisco, McKinney, Dallas, Coppell, Rockwall & GarlandPump It Up – located in FriscoAltitude Trampoline Park – located in Richardson

Peppa Pig World of Play – located in Grapevine. Ideal on your bucket list of toddler play places
NorthPark Center – take the kids to see the ducks and turtles
What are your favorite indoor places for kids? Tell us in the comments below and we’ll add them to our list!
